newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen down on weak confidence.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen down on weak confidence.

text.p: Thai stocks would likely decline on Friday on weak market confidence and jitters over the outcome of a planned alliance between Thai Danu Bank Plc and Finance One Plc, brokers said.

"Investors are a bit worried about the Thai Danu, Finance One alliance. They feel if the talks today collapsed, it would trigger a psychological impact on other finance firms thinking about similar mergers," said Suppachai Ekkul of Nithipat Capital.
The SET index closed 14.80 points lower at 581.39 on 5.6 billion baht turnover on Thursday.
The two companies are expected to review their talks on Friday.
Brokers said investors also watched if a 50 billion baht market support fund would buy stocks in the market.
Brokers said they believed about one billion baht of the fund pooled by commercial banks may have been invested in the market earlier this week.
